[{"id":"BS-65","entityId":"2-312","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"BS"},{"name":"summary","value":"Add selected notification before notice send"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Garth Murray"},{"name":"created","value":"1590526683093"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"65"},{"name":"description","value":"

When choosing a number of Adjusters to deploy from the adjusters search page, the count of number selected is buried at the bottom of the page.

This has resulted in multiple notifications being sent out to users.

In the Standby and Deployment popup please add a count of the currently selected adjusters that this will be going to as well as a confirmation checkbox that they have to check in order to send out the notification.

"You are sending this notification to X adjusters. Check here that this is correct."

Can use the DataTables logic to pull in total number of users and the like.

Currently a summation of the deployed adjusters on projects doesn't match the Master Report.

This is most likely due to the fact that changing a adjuster to not-deployed is a manual process and some might have been missed. Let's run some queries and figure out where the data is missing.

SELECT * FROM users_deployments WHERE adjuster_id NOT IN (SELECT id FROM users)

SELECT * FROM users_deployment_notifications WHERE deployment_id NOT IN (select id from deployments)

SELECT * FROM users_deployment_notifications WHERE adjuster_id NOT IN (select id from users)

Dupont","issueId":"BS-44","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

SELECT users_deployments.id AS user_deployment_id, users.firstname, users.lastname, deployments.incident_name, concat("https://portal.grsbridge.com/adjuster/", users.id) as user_profile_link, concat("https://portal.grsbridge.com/deployments/roster/all/", deployments.id) as user_profile_link FROM users_deployments LEFT JOIN users ON users.id = users_deployments.adjuster_id LEFT JOIN deployments ON deployments.id = users_deployments.deployment_id WHERE users_deployments.active = 1 AND adjuster_id IN ( SELECT adjuster_id FROM users_deployments WHERE active = 1 GROUP BY adjuster_id HAVING count(deployment_id) > 1 ) ORDER BY adjuster_id

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1590001043312,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"4-65","author":"rdupont","authorFullName":"Rick Dupont","issueId":"BS-44","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

Also discovered 24 adjusters with multiple deployments set as active. Created a CSV and sent to @Kris Anolfo for further research.

those who have their own policy and those who have invalid selections on their application are both under 'No Deduction’. Add the option 'Invalid WC Form' to the dropdown to differentiate the errors from actual No Deduction adjusters. There is also no place to capture WC information (policy company name, policy number, and effective dates) and upload supporting documentation.

"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Garth Murray"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"garthpmurray"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"3"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"garthpmurray"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1589990058266"},{"name":"links","value":[{"value":"BS-46","type":"Subtask","role":"parent for"}]},{"name":"State","value":["Open"],"valueId":["Open"],"color":null},{"name":"Sprints","value":["Sprint 4"],"valueId":["Sprint 4"],"color":null},{"name":"Type","value":["User Story"],"valueId":["User Story"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Minor"],"valueId":["Minor"],"color":{"bg":"#e6e6e6","fg":"#888"}},{"name":"Affected versions","value":["1.2.1"],"valueId":["1.2.1"],"color":null},{"name":"Story points","value":["5"],"valueId":["5"],"color":null}],"comment":[{"id":"4-0","author":"garthpmurray","authorFullName":"Garth Murray","issueId":"BS-8","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Kris Anolfo just to clarify, we want new inputs on just the admin adjuster view to capture policy company name, policy number, and effective dates or on both?

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1581951835905,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"4-1","author":"Kanolfo","authorFullName":"Kris Anolfo","issueId":"BS-8","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Garth Murray the problem we have with this data is is twofold.

  1. On the 1099 employment application the adjuster is asked if they have their own policy and if they do they are instructed to provide their WC information by typing in the policy company name, policy number or self-insurance permit number, coverage start and end dates, and then upload a photo of the policy. Instead of uploading a copy of their policy they'll upload a copy of their driver's license or a picture of their cat.

  2. In BridgeSource the field Workers Compensation Deduction (should) defaults to not reviewed until admin reviews the adjuster's employment application. They will change the field to deduct from payroll if the adjuster does not carry their own policy and wants to enrol in ours or no deduction if the adjuster has provided correct WC information.

The first problem is what to do with those who state they have their own policy, but did not provide the required information thus requiring some sort of follow up from the admin team, The Workers Compensation Deduction dropdown options of not reviewed, deduct from payroll, and no deduction don't fully apply to them yet because they did not provide the required information. Having a third option such as invalid documentation would help identify these adjusters.

The second problem is that we are not capturing any of their WC data in their profiles - none of the data they provide is being entered into their profile and there's no place to upload the documentation they send to us. I don't think we need text fields for policy company name or policy number if we are going to upload the policy itself. However I do think we should capture coverage start date and coverage end date. Knowing these dates will allow us to determine if the adjuster had coverage during the days they were deployed to a project (since the projects should capture start and release dates) and could also help us track adjusters who have expired policies - maybe having those with coverage end date after "today" can automatically turn to invalid documentation.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1581956350074,"updated":1589909240733,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"4-56","author":"garthpmurray","authorFullName":"Garth Murray","issueId":"BS-8","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

Workers Compensation Deduction should default to unreviewed on new profiles.

Add status column for valid/invalid Works Compensation Deduction This will only apply if Workers Compensation Deduction is No Deduction.

Add capture points for Policy Company Name Policy Number Coverage Start Coverage End - On admin side. Only show these fields if No Deduction is chosen for Workers Compensation Deduction

Flip status column to valid if all fields are filled out and current date is inside the Start End.

if Status column is marked as invalid, fields outlined in red.

Cron job that runs and marks status column as invalid if date falls after end date of coverage. Ignore other Workers Compensation Deduction options.

On adjuster search page:
Fix Workers Compensation Deduction to match fields if they map to the same column. If not, lets circle back.

Add a filter for those with an invalid status column from above.

There are several missing elements from the assignments page. Needs to be updated and the following added to it.

Remove loss type
Show all 3 phonenumbers
Better Date formatting - Month, Day year
Always show pencil

Weather -
Add max hailsize and damage probability to storm details

Property Data
Unit B or Number B on assignment 11 to check better data
Scrollable box for drone information

Photos -
Upload Photo doesn’t allow click
Upload Photo Rework - do line by line.

Documents
Same upload rework, allow type
uploaded by needs to be name
